title: Trump says he is 'not happy' with deadly Russian strikes on Kyiv
snippets: The overnight strikes killed at least eight people and injured 77 more,  local officials have said.
titles: Trump says he is 'not happy' with deadly Russian strikes on Kyiv
summary: Overnight strikes in an undisclosed location resulted in at least eight fatalities and 77 injuries, according to local officials. The current status of the situation or the identity of the perpetrators has not been disclosed.

title: Israeli military admits its troops killed UN worker in Gaza Strip
snippets: Israel had previously denied its troops were responsible for the killing of a UN worker with tank fire on 19 March.
titles: Israeli military admits its troops killed UN worker in Gaza Strip
summary: Israel has reversed its initial denial, acknowledging that its troops were responsible for the death of a UN worker killed by tank fire on 19 March. This marks a significant shift in the official stance regarding the incident.

title: At least 59 Palestinians killed as Israel escalates Gaza bombardment
snippets: Israeli strikes across Gaza kill at least 59 as military issues evacuation orders for Beit Hanoon and Sheikh Zeid.
titles: At least 59 Palestinians killed as Israel escalates Gaza bombardment
summary: Israeli military operations in Gaza have resulted in at least 59 deaths. Additionally, evacuation orders have been issued for the areas of Beit Hanoon and Sheikh Zeid as part of these actions.

title: Trump makes rare criticism of Putin after Russia’s deadly Kyiv attacks
snippets: At least 12 people were killed in a Russian missile attack on the Ukrainian capital.
titles: Trump makes rare criticism of Putin after Russia’s deadly Kyiv attacks
summary: A Russian missile attack on the Ukrainian capital resulted in at least 12 fatalities. This incident marks a significant escalation in the conflict between Russia and Ukraine, highlighting the ongoing violence and its impact on civilians.

title: India-Pakistan tensions escalate after deadly Kashmir attack
snippets: A day after India suspended a water-sharing treaty and downgraded diplomatic ties with Pakistan, authorities in Islamabad closed airspace to Indian aircraft and suspended all trade with India.
titles: India-Pakistan tensions escalate after deadly Kashmir attack
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful context about international relations and conflict, which can help readers understand current events.
summary: Following India's suspension of a water-sharing treaty and the downgrading of diplomatic relations with Pakistan, Islamabad responded by closing its airspace to Indian aircraft and halting all trade between the two countries. This escalation in tensions marks a significant downturn in the bilateral relationship.

title: 2025 Zurich Classic scores: Isaiah Salinda, Kevin Velo set record as Rory McIlroy makes return after Masters
snippets: After low scores in Thursday's four-ball format, the field will transition to foursomes on Friday
titles: 2025 Zurich Classic scores: Isaiah Salinda, Kevin Velo set record as Rory McIlroy makes return after Masters
summary: Following Thursday's four-ball format in the golf tournament, where teams generally posted low scores, the competition will shift to the foursomes format on Friday. This change in format is a scheduled part of the tournament's progression.

title: Kobe debut Lakers jersey sells for record $7M
snippets: A jersey photo-matched to seven games in Kobe Bryant's 1996-97 rookie season for the Lakers sold for $7 million at Sotheby's on Thursday.
titles: Kobe debut Lakers jersey sells for record $7M
summary: A jersey worn by Kobe Bryant during his 1996-97 rookie season with the Lakers was sold for $7 million at a Sotheby's auction on Thursday. This jersey, verified through photo-matching to have been worn in seven games, set a record for the highest price ever paid for a game-worn sports memorabilia item.

title: Nick Saban shared the perfect analogy explaining why some NFL Draft prospects don't pan out
snippets: Nick Saban shared his experience evaluating NFL Draft qualities in players.
titles: Nick Saban shared the perfect analogy explaining why some NFL Draft prospects don't pan out
summary: Nick Saban, a renowned college football coach, discussed his approach to assessing NFL Draft qualities in players. He emphasized the importance of not only physical abilities but also mental toughness, discipline, and the capacity to learn and adapt. Saban's insights reflect his extensive experience in developing athletes for professional careers, highlighting the multifaceted nature of player evaluation for the NFL Draft.

summary: The news content provides an update on the first round picks in a sports draft, alongside a list of the best available players based on a consensus big board. The focus is on tracking the progression of picks and highlighting top talent yet to be selected.

title: Intel to cut jobs and capex as Trump tariffs cloud outlook
snippets: US chipmaker’s shares fall in after-market trading as it offers downbeat guidance
titles: Intel to cut jobs and capex as Trump tariffs cloud outlook
summary: A US chipmaker experienced a decline in its share prices during after-market trading following the company's issuance of a lower-than-expected financial outlook. This downbeat guidance suggests the company anticipates weaker financial performance in the future.

title: Trump urges Putin to stop attacks on Ukraine
snippets: US president signals frustration with Kremlin even as his administration makes overtures towards Russia
titles: Trump urges Putin to stop attacks on Ukraine
summary: The US President has shown signs of frustration with the Kremlin, despite his administration's efforts to engage diplomatically with Russia. This indicates a complex relationship between the two nations, with ongoing attempts at dialogue amidst underlying tensions.

title: Alphabet shares rise as Google search boosts profits
snippets: Silicon Valley giant says AI is helping engagement in core division despite threat from ChatGPT
titles: Alphabet shares rise as Google search boosts profits
summary: A Silicon Valley tech giant reports that its core division is experiencing increased engagement thanks to the integration of artificial intelligence (AI), even amid competition from ChatGPT.

title: Trump’s shameful Crimea ultimatum to Ukraine
snippets: Washington is trying to force on Kyiv a peace deal on Russia’s terms
titles: Trump’s shameful Crimea ultimatum to Ukraine
summary: Washington is reportedly pressuring Kyiv to accept a peace agreement favorable to Russia. This development indicates a significant shift in the diplomatic stance of the United States regarding the conflict between Ukraine and Russia. The current status of these negotiations or the response from Kyiv remains unclear.

title: S&P 500 Gains and Losses Today: ServiceNow Stock Soars as AI Demand Drives Earnings
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • The S&P 500 jumped 2.0% on Thursday, April 24, with surging tech stocks and hopes for thawing trade relationships helping drive a third consecutive day of gains.
  • Enterprise software firm ServiceNow posted strong quarterly results, highlighting demand for its AI-enabled products, and its shares pushed higher.
  • Shares of financial technology firm Fiserv dropped as softness in its point-of-sale and payment processing business weighed on results.


Major U.S. equities indexes gained ground for the third straight session. Although Trump administration officials have offered mixed comments on trade policy, this week's rally has coincided with increased optimism that negotiations could result in lower tariffs.

The S&P 500 advanced 2.0%, while the Dow ended 1.2% higher. Strength in the tech sector helped boost the Nasdaq, which soared 2.7%. 

ServiceNow shares (NOW) jumped 15.5%, notching the top performance in the S&P 500, after the cloud-based enterprise software firm topped sales and profit forecasts with its first-quarter results. ServiceNow indicated that tariffs, trade negotiations, and government efficiency efforts represent an opportunity, rather than a headwind, for its products designed to help organizations automate and modernize their processes.  

Hasbro (HAS) reported better-than-expected sales and profits for the first quarter, and shares of the toymaker surged 14.6%. The home to brands like Nerf and Play-Doh also maintained its full-year guidance, despite uncertainties about the potential impact of tariffs. In addition, Hasbro announced an extension of its licensing deal with Disney (DIS), meaning the company will continue producing toys for the entertainment giant's popular franchises such as Marvel and Star Wars.

Semiconductor manufacturer Microchip Technology (MCHP) unveiled a new power module designed to improve power management for data centers and industrial automation processes. Microchip's new product aims to boost efficiency and minimize power loss with a compact solution that requires less board space. Microchip shares advanced 12.4% on Thursday. 

Shares of financial technology firm Fiserv (FI) plunged 18.5%, suffering the steepest drop of any S&P 500 constituent, following a mixed quarterly earnings report. Although profits topped expectations, revenue fell short of forecasts, reflecting slower growth in the company's Clover point-of-sale business and lower payment processing activity in its merchant solutions segment. Fiserv also announced an agreement to acquire Brazilian fintech firm Money Money, aiming to supplement Clover's operations by providing financing to small businesses in the country.

Auto parts provider LKQ (LKQ) also missed quarterly sales estimates, and its shares skidded 11.6%. Adjusted earnings per share (EPS) were down year-over-year, and LKQ reported negative free cash flow (FCF) during the period. Although the company left its guidance unchanged, it is monitoring possible tariff impacts, indicating that it formed a dedicated task force to evaluate potential challenges and opportunities related to the shifting global trade environment.

Although International Business Machines (IBM) posted better-than-expected quarterly sales and profits, the tech giant's top executive warned that customers could rein in their spending as they navigate economic uncertainty and transformations in government policy. IBM shares sank 6.6% on Thursday.
titles: S&P 500 Gains and Losses Today: ServiceNow Stock Soars as AI Demand Drives Earnings
summary: The S&P 500 saw a 2.0% increase on April 24, buoyed by a surge in tech stocks and optimism over easing trade tensions, marking the third straight day of gains. ServiceNow's shares jumped 15.5% following strong quarterly results, driven by demand for its AI products. Conversely, Fiserv's shares dropped 18.5% due to disappointing revenue, despite an acquisition aimed at boosting its Clover business in Brazil. Other notable movements included Hasbro's 14.6% rise after exceeding sales expectations and extending its Disney licensing deal, and Microchip Technology's 12.4% gain with the launch of a n

title: 'Bone collector' caterpillar wears dead insect body parts as disguise
snippets: A carnivorous caterpillar species camouflages itself with dead insects so it can live safely alongside spiders, stalking their webs and stealing their prey
titles: 'Bone collector' caterpillar wears dead insect body parts as disguise
summary: A carnivorous caterpillar species has developed a unique survival strategy by camouflaging itself with dead insects. This adaptation allows it to coexist alongside spiders within their webs without being detected. The caterpillar not only hides from potential threats through this disguise but also exploits the situation by stealing prey caught in the spider's web. This behavior showcases a remarkable example of adaptive evolution in the natural world.

title: Awkward. Humans are still better than AI at reading the room
snippets: Humans are better than current AI models at interpreting social interactions and understanding social dynamics in moving scenes. Researchers believe this is because AI neural networks were inspired by the infrastructure of the part of the brain that processes static images, which is different from the area of the brain that processes dynamic social scenes.
titles: Awkward. Humans are still better than AI at reading the room
summary: Researchers have found that humans outperform current AI models in understanding social interactions and dynamics in moving scenes. This is attributed to the design of AI neural networks, which are inspired by the brain's region that processes static images, not the part that handles dynamic social scenes.

title: Can technology revolutionize health science? The promise of exposomics
snippets: Researchers in the field of exposomics explain how cutting-edge technologies are unlocking this biological archive, ushering in a new era of disease prevention and personalized medicine.
titles: Can technology revolutionize health science? The promise of exposomics
summary: Researchers in exposomics are using advanced technologies to analyze the biological archive of environmental exposures, marking a significant advancement in disease prevention and personalized medicine. This field aims to understand how various environmental factors impact human health, potentially leading to more targeted and effective treatments.

title: Nanophotonic platform boosts efficiency of nonlinear-optical quantum teleportation
snippets: Researchers have long recognized that quantum communication systems would transmit quantum information more faithfully and be impervious to certain forms of error if nonlinear optical processes were used. However, past efforts at incorporating such processes could not operate with the extremely low light levels required for quantum communication.
titles: Nanophotonic platform boosts efficiency of nonlinear-optical quantum teleportation
summary: Researchers have identified that using nonlinear optical processes in quantum communication systems could enhance fidelity and resistance to certain errors. Previous attempts to integrate these processes failed because they couldn't function at the low light levels essential for quantum communication.

title: Quantum sensors tested for next-generation particle physics experiments
snippets: Researchers have developed a novel high-energy particle detection instrumentation approach that leverages the power of quantum sensors -- devices capable of precisely detecting single particles.
titles: Quantum sensors tested for next-generation particle physics experiments
summary: Researchers have created a new method for detecting high-energy particles using quantum sensors, which can accurately identify single particles. This advancement in particle detection technology represents a significant step forward in the field, offering more precise measurements than previously possible.
